name: Ludwig Wittgenstein
background: Influential 20th century philosopher. Wrote Tractatus and Philosophical Investigations. Transformed philosophy twice - first with logical atomism, then with ordinary language philosophy.

principles.name: Meaning is use
principles.description: Words don't have fixed meanings - they gain meaning from how they're used in practice. Don't ask what a word means, ask how it's used. Context determines meaning.
principles.falsification: When formal definitions and specifications genuinely capture meaning (legal contracts, mathematical definitions)

principles.name: The limits of my language mean the limits of my world
principles.description: What you can express constrains what you can think. Precise language enables precise thought. Fuzzy terminology produces fuzzy reasoning.
principles.falsification: When intuition and tacit knowledge outperform explicit articulation

principles.name: Whereof one cannot speak, thereof one must be silent
principles.description: Don't theorize about what lies beyond analysis. Acknowledge the boundaries of meaningful discourse. Some questions are malformed, not unanswered.
principles.falsification: When speculation and metaphor productively extend understanding beyond strict analysis
